description.en: This ontology defines a heirarchy of software functions based on the work of the NSF-funded EarthCube Resource Registry working group.  The functions are generally organized by their role in the research process.

creditCitation.value: Duerr, R., 2019, "Software Functions Ontology", ESIP Community Ontology Repository, http://cor.esipfed.org/ont/earthcube/sfo

description.en: Functions to produce a higher level defined data product

comment.en: Examples: MODIS L2 processing; geophysical forward modeling and inversion (e.g., SpecFEM3D, ModEM, etc); hydrological modeling (e.g., TopoFlow, ModFlow, etc); weather modeling and data assimilation (WRF)

description.en: Functions to orchestrate a series of tools in an automated fashion to perform some reproducible task.

comment.en: Examples: Kepler, Taverna, VisTrails

description.en: Functions that enable interaction with data to determine usability, suitability for specific use,  for hypothesis generation, or evaluation of patterns suggesting the need for further analysis.

comment.en: Examples: NLP annotation; ArcGIS; RapidMiner;

description.en: Functions to refine data for use in data analysis or other purposes.

comment.en: Examples: MODIS cal/Val; Excel (save as); Google Refine

description.en: Functions that enable the preservation of digital information, through transformation of the full information content from one form to another.

Functions that enable data to remain accessible and usable for a period of time long enough for there to be concern about the impacts of changing technologies, including support for new media and data formats, and of a changing Designated Community.
Functions that enable arrangement, coordination, and management of a complex series of processes that depend on one another for their proper functioning.
Functions that enable management of the provenance of 1) the definition of a workflow, 2) a workflow run, and 3) the data used or created by the workflow.
Functions that enable a workflow process to be reproduced.

comment.en: Typically reproducibility of a process or workflow requires that any input parameters, data, the sequence of steps, and the code used in the workflow be available and documented for re-use.

description.en: Functions to visually display data.

comment.en: Examples: ASINA (https://nsidc.org/arcticseaicenews/); Google Earth; ParaView

description.en: Functions that describe key aspects of a resource or its usage, or of new insights from data

comment.en: Examples: Google Analytics

description.en: Functions to enable hypothesis testing or to gain insights from data.

comment.en: Examples: Topic modeling; Named entity recognition; ArcMap; various R statistical or image processing packages;

description.en: Functions that allow users to visually map relevant concepts, processes, and other entities relevant to planning their research.

comment.en: Examples: mindmapping, concept mapping, brainstorming software

description.en: Examples: Microsoft Project, GanttPro, Redmine, Airtable, Trello
Functions that maintain and conserve data in a usable and useful condition for the long term

comment.en: Examples: Data Conservancy; Fedora, DataOne; DataVerse

description.en: Functions that support aspects of software development.

comment.en: Examples: GitHub, Subversion, Eclipse,

description.en: The function that software performs during the research process.

comment.en: Example: The concept “Research Planning” may be used to describe the function of sofware used in generating a plan for a research project.

description.en: Functions enabling incorporation of new data into an information system.

comment.en: Data might originate from instruments or from other information systems.

description.en: Functions that enable an agent to locate and access (acquire for use) information resources

comment.en: Examples: ElasticSearch; web map server (GeoServer); OpenSearch; Thredds; Apache Nutch, Sparkler

description.en: Functions used in generating a scientific and logistic plan for executing a research project.

comment.en: Examples: Data management planning tools; concept mapping tools; project management tools

description.en: Functions that involve human-machine communication necessary for the operation of some component of a research project.

comment.en: Examples: list-serve software; wiki software; OAuth

description.en: Functions for evaluating and ascertaining the completeness and quality of code, determining if it complies with its requirements, performs functions for which it is intended and meets the organization's goals and user needs.
Functions that track changes made to a digital asset over time
Functions to improve the efficiency and quality of code.
Functions that present data and information in a form suitable for visual perception and decision-making by a person.
Functions used to manipulate images or data so they appear as moving images.
Functions (i.e., algorithms and statistical models) used to perform a specific task without using explicit instructions, relying on patterns and inference observed in input test data instead.

comment.en: Functions that transforms report data and layout information into a specific format.

description.en: Functions to collect and submit data so that accurate analyses of the facts on the ground can be performed.
Functions used to generate two-dimensional or three-dimensional images from a model.
Functions that automate or partly automate the generation of documentation.

comment.en: Example: Live OWL Documentation Environment (LODE)

description.en: Functions that allow the usage of a resource to be monitored.
Functions that optimally combine theory, often in the form of models, with available data.
Functions that allow users to adjust model parameters and forcings so that model outputs match observed values.
Funcions that use formal techniques to study entities using their topological, geometric, or geographic properties
Functions for collecting, exploring and presenting large amounts of data to discover underlying patterns and trends.
Functions that combine data from different sources into a single, unified view.
Functions that use statistical methods to analyze time series data and extract meaningful statistics and characteristics about the data.
Structured techniques used to mathematically analyze a network of interconnected components.
Functions that allow quantitative analyses and/or algorithms applied to digital image (including multimedia) data.
Functions that parse texts in order to extract machine-readable facts from them, thereby creating structured data out of free text content.

comment.en: Example: Natural Language Processing

description.en: Functions that transform the representation of the data.

comment.en: Examples: spatial transformation, format conversion, interpolation, regridding, etc.

description.en: Functions that allow users to extract a portion of a larger data set.

comment.en: Examples: channel selection, spatial subsetting, temporal subsetting

description.en: Functions to create, update and remove user accounts and their rights and capabilities within a system.
Functions that help agents develop and/or validate the metadata and other markup needed to 1) make their data usable in the short and long term or 2) prepare it for further processing and analysis.

comment.en: Examples: AgriMetamaker, C Compliance Checker, M3Cat, Metacat, Morpho, SPASE metadata editor

description.en: Functions that generate geometrical shapes that cover a physical domain.

comment.en: Examples: LaGriT, GridTool, Gridgen, NWGrid

description.en: Functions that generate test data.
Functions that help ensure that the data being used is clean and consistent.

comment.en: Examples: OpenRefine, DataWrangler, DataCleaner

description.en: Functions that allow users to anonymize, deidentify, blur or otherwise alter or hide portions of data to protect information because of ethical and legal issues

comment.en: Example tools: ARX Data Anonymization Tool, Amnesia, sdcMicro

description.en: Functions that convert data into a useable and desired form.
Functions that allow users to computationally model physical processes.
Functions used to validate the output products of processing or modeling softare.
Functions that allow the outputs of one model to feed into another model.
Functions that enable an agent to access or order data.

comment.en: Examples: NOAA's HadISST Sea Ice Component, 1°, Global, Monthly, 1870-present Data Subset Service, NSIDC Near-Real-Time SSM/I-SSMIS EASE-Grid Daily Global Ice Concentration and Snow Extent, Version 5 subscription service

description.en: Functions that automatically and systematically search some portion of the World Wide Web for items that meet provided criteria (e.g., specific keywords, certain file types).

comment.en: Examples: Apache Nutch, Octoparse, Dexi.io

description.en: The function of extracting specified information/data from specific, targeted sites.

comment.en: Examples: EnhancedOAIServer, OAIA, WAF, arcIMS, Z39.50

description.en: The function of systematically analyzing groups of data in order to uncover previously unknown patterns and relationships.

comment.en: Examples: RapidMiner Studio, STATISTICA, KNIME Analytics Platform

description.en: Functions that allow users to perform initial investigations on data so as to discover patterns, to spot anomalies, to test hypothesis and/or to check assumptions with the help of summary statistics and graphical representations.

comment.en: Examples: pandas, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn

description.en: Functions that prospectively ensure the quality of data to be acquired or which verify the data's reasonableness after acquisition through the use of techniques such as flagging outlying values, etc.

comment.en: Examples: ZenQMS, SmartSolve, Qualio

description.en: Functions that authenticate and/or control access to specific capabilities.

comment.en: Examples: OAuth, OpenID

description.en: Functions that enable planning for the logistics needed to support research in the field.

comment.en: Examples: Easyship, LogiMap, DELMIA Quintiq Logistics Planning
Functions to enable the development and management of data management plans.

description.en: Functions that allow notification of events, or other happenings.

comment.en: Examples: Appwoodoo, OneSignal, Notifu, PyOxidizer

description.en: Functions to control the operation of a scientific instrument.

comment.en: Examples: MATLAB Instrument Control Box, LabView, Systems Test and Operations Language

description.en: Functions that allow a user to interact with a system.

comment.en: Examples: browsers, flyover country app

description.en: Functions that allow users to form communities across space and time and to interact with one another remotely.

comment.en: Examples: AGU Connect, Facebook, MediaWiki, DokuWiki, Google groups, listservs, zoom

description.en: Functions to ingest data into a data system.

comment.en: Examples: Apache Kafka, Datatorrent, Apache Samza

description.en: The function that enables an agent to query a system that retrieves a list of data that match the agent's search criteria and which might be suitable for their purpose.

comment.en: Examples: NSIDC Scientific Data Search, data.gov, USGS ScienceBase

description.en: Functions to calibrate an instrument.

comment.en: Examples: MODIS cal/val, EasyCal, Calibration Studio

description.en: Functions to handle data that is streaming in real-time.

comment.en: Examples: CHORDS
